Create Directus Personal Access Token

generate_directus_pat.Rd

This function generates a personal access token (PAT) for a user who has been registered on data.drives-network.org. The PAT is is an alternative to an API key, meant to be used for single sessions with the API. The PAT expires after about 10 minutes and can be regenerated as many times as needed by the user.

Usage

generate_directus_pat(
  useremail = NULL,
  userpassword = NULL,
  myurl = getOption("drivesR.default.url")
)

Arguments

useremail

Email address registered with data.drives-network.org.

userpassword

Account password.

myurl

Default url (data.drives-network.org)

Value

Returns a text object "Bearer newPAT" that can be used as the input for set_default_token().

Details

If using this in a script, the user email and password should be read from an external file.

Examples

# not run: source("directus_creds.R") ## script that reads email and password,
#not run: mypat <- generate_directus_pat(# objects created in "directus_creds.R"
#                                          useremail = directus_email, 
#                                          userpassword = directus_password)
# not run: set_default_token(mypat)
# not run: test_api_token(mypat) # to check if it works.
